verses.text: The burden which the prophet Habakkuk saw.
parts: burden which the prophet Habakkuk saw.

verses.text: O , how long shall I cry,And You will not hear?Even cry out to You, “Violence!”And You will not save.
Why do You show me iniquity,And cause me to see trouble?For plundering and violence are before me;There is strife, and contention arises.
parts: Why do You show me iniquity,
There is strife, and contention arises.

verses.text: Therefore the law is powerless,And justice never goes forth.For the wicked surround the righteous;Therefore perverse judgment proceeds.
parts: For the wicked surround the righteous;

verses.text: “Look among the nations and watch—Be utterly astounded!For I will work a work in your daysWhich you would not believe, though it were told you.
parts: work a work in your days
you would not believe, though it were told

verses.text: For indeed I am raising up the Chaldeans,A bitter and hasty nationWhich marches through the breadth of the earth,To possess dwelling places that are not theirs.
parts: For indeed I am raising up the Chaldeans,
Which marches through the breadth of the earth,

verses.text: They are terrible and dreadful;Their judgment and their dignity proceed from themselves.
parts: Their judgment and their dignity proceed from themselves.

verses.text: Their horses also are swifter than leopards,And more fierce than evening wolves.Their chargers charge ahead;Their cavalry comes from afar;They fly as the eagle that hastens to eat.
parts: Their horses also are swifter than leopards,
And more fierce than evening wolves.

verses.text: “They all come for violence;Their faces are set like the east wind.They gather captives like sand.
They scoff at kings,And princes are scorned by them.They deride every stronghold,For they heap up earthen mounds and seize it.
parts: And princes are scorned by them.

verses.text: Then his mind changes, and he transgresses;He commits offense,Ascribing this power to his god.”
Are You not from everlasting,O  my God, my Holy One?We shall not die.O , You have appointed them for judgment;O Rock, You have marked them for correction.
parts: , You have appointed them for judgment;
O Rock, You have marked them for correction.

verses.text: You are of purer eyes than to behold evil,And cannot look on wickedness.Why do You look on those who deal treacherously,And hold Your tongue when the wicked devoursA person more righteous than he?
parts: of purer eyes than to behold evil,
Why do You look on those who deal treacherously,
hold Your tongue when the wicked devours

verses.text: Why do You make men like fish of the sea,Like creeping things that have no ruler over them?
parts: do You make men like fish of the sea,

verses.text: They take up all of them with a hook,They catch them in their net,And gather them in their dragnet.Therefore they rejoice and are glad.
parts: They take up all of them with a hook,
They catch them in their net,
And gather them in their dragnet.
Therefore they rejoice and are glad.

verses.text: Therefore they sacrifice to their net,And burn incense to their dragnet;Because by them their share is sumptuousAnd their food plentiful.
parts: Therefore they sacrifice to their net,
And burn incense to their dragnet;

verses.text: Shall they therefore empty their net,And continue to slay nations without pity?
parts: Shall they therefore empty their net,
And continue to slay nations without pity?

verses.text: I will stand my watchAnd set myself on the rampart,And watch to see what He will say to me,And what I will answer when I am corrected.
parts: And set myself on the rampart,
And watch to see what He will say to me,
And what I will answer when I am corrected.

verses.text: Then the  answered me and said:“Write the visionAnd make it plain on tablets,That he may run who reads it.
parts: answered me and said:“Write the vision
That he may run who reads it.

verses.text: For the vision is yet for an appointed time;But at the end it will speak, and it will not lie.Though it tarries, wait for it;Because it will surely come,It will not tarry.
parts: But at the end it will speak, and it will not lie.
Though it tarries, wait for it;

verses.text: “Behold the proud,His soul is not upright in him;But the just shall live by his faith.
parts: His soul is not upright in him;
But the just shall live by his faith.

verses.text: “Indeed, because he transgresses by wine,He is a proud man,And he does not stay at home.Because he enlarges his desire as hell,And he is like death, and cannot be satisfied,He gathers to himself all nationsAnd heaps up for himself all peoples.
parts: And he does not stay at home.
Because he enlarges his desire as
like death, and cannot be satisfied,
He gathers to himself all nations
And heaps up for himself all peoples.

verses.text: “Will not all these take up a proverb against him,And a taunting riddle against him, and say,‘Woe to him who increasesWhat is not his—how long?And to him who loads himself with many pledges’?
parts: “Will not all these take up a proverb against him,
And a taunting riddle against him, and say,

verses.text: Will not your creditors rise up suddenly?Will they not awaken who oppress you?And you will become their booty.
parts: Will they not awaken who oppress you?
And you will become their booty.

verses.text: Because you have plundered many nations,All the remnant of the people shall plunder you,Because of men’s bloodAnd the violence of the land and the city,And of all who dwell in it.
parts: Because you have plundered many nations,
All the remnant of the people shall plunder you,
And the violence of the land
And of all who dwell in it.

verses.text: “Woe to him who covets evil gain for his house,That he may set his nest on high,That he may be delivered from the power of disaster!
parts: “Woe to him who covets evil gain for his house,
That he may set his nest on high,
That he may be delivered from the

verses.text: You give shameful counsel to your house,Cutting off many peoples,And sin against your soul.
parts: You give shameful counsel to your house,

verses.text: For the stone will cry out from the wall,And the beam from the timbers will answer it.
parts: For the stone will cry out from the wall,
And the beam from the timbers will answer it.

verses.text: “Woe to him who builds a town with bloodshed,Who establishes a city by iniquity!
parts: “Woe to him who builds a town with bloodshed,
Who establishes a city by iniquity!

verses.text: Behold, is it not of the  of hostsThat the peoples labor to feed the fire,And nations weary themselves in vain?
parts: And nations weary themselves in vain?

verses.text: For the earth will be filledWith the knowledge of the glory of the ,As the waters cover the sea.
parts: For the earth will be filled
With the knowledge of the glory of the
As the waters cover the sea.

verses.text: “Woe to him who gives drink to his neighbor,Pressing him to your bottle,Even to make him drunk,That you may look on his nakedness!
parts: “Woe to him who gives drink to his neighbor,

verses.text: You are filled with shame instead of glory.You also—drink!And be exposed as uncircumcised!The cup of the ’s right hand will be turned against you,And utter shame will be on your glory.
parts: You are filled with shame instead of glory.
And utter shame will be on your glory.

verses.text: For the violence done to Lebanon will cover you,And the plunder of beasts which made them afraid,Because of men’s bloodAnd the violence of the land and the city,And of all who dwell in it.
parts: And the violence of the land
And of all who dwell in it.

verses.text: “What profit is the image, that its maker should carve it,The molded image, a teacher of lies,That the maker of its mold should trust in it,To make mute idols?
parts: “What profit is the image, that its maker should carve it,
The molded image, a teacher of lies,
That the maker of its mold should trust in it,

verses.text: Woe to him who says to wood, ‘Awake!’To silent stone, ‘Arise! It shall teach!’Behold, it is overlaid with gold and silver,Yet in it there is no breath at all.
parts: Woe to him who says to wood, ‘Awake!’
To silent stone, ‘Arise! It shall teach!’
Behold, it is overlaid with gold and silver,
Yet in it there is no breath at all.

verses.text: “But the  is in His holy temple.Let all the earth keep silence before Him.”
parts: Let all the earth keep silence before Him.”

verses.text: O , I have heard Your speech and was afraid;O , revive Your work in the midst of the years!In the midst of the years make it known;In wrath remember mercy.
parts: , revive Your work in the midst of the years!
In the midst of the years make

verses.text: God came from Teman,The Holy One from Mount Paran. SelahHis glory covered the heavens,And the earth was full of His praise.
parts: The Holy One from Mount Paran.
And the earth was full of His praise.

verses.text: His brightness was like the light;He had rays flashing from His hand,And there His power was hidden.
Before Him went pestilence,And fever followed at His feet.
parts: And fever followed at His feet.

verses.text: He stood and measured the earth;He looked and startled the nations.And the everlasting mountains were scattered,The perpetual hills bowed.His ways are everlasting.
parts: He stood and measured the earth;
He looked and startled the nations.
And the everlasting mountains were scattered,

verses.text: I saw the tents of Cushan in affliction;The curtains of the land of Midian trembled.
parts: I saw the tents of Cushan in affliction;
The curtains of the land of Midian trembled.

verses.text: O , were You displeased with the rivers,Was Your anger against the rivers,Was Your wrath against the sea,That You rode on Your horses,Your chariots of salvation?
parts: That You rode on Your horses,

verses.text: Your bow was made quite ready;Oaths were sworn over Your arrows. SelahYou divided the earth with rivers.
parts: Your bow was made quite ready;
You divided the earth with rivers.

verses.text: The mountains saw You and trembled;The overflowing of the water passed by.The deep uttered its voice,And lifted its hands on high.
parts: The overflowing of the water passed by.

verses.text: The sun and moon stood still in their habitation;At the light of Your arrows they went,At the shining of Your glittering spear.
parts: The sun and moon stood still in their habitation;
At the light of Your arrows they went,
At the shining of Your glittering spear.

verses.text: You marched through the land in indignation;You trampled the nations in anger.
parts: You marched through the land in indignation;

verses.text: You went forth for the salvation of Your people,For salvation with Your Anointed.You struck the head from the house of the wicked,By laying bare from foundation to neck. Selah
parts: You went forth for the salvation of Your people,
You struck the head from the house of the wicked,
By laying bare from foundation to neck.

verses.text: You thrust through with his own arrowsThe head of his villages.They came out like a whirlwind to scatter me;Their rejoicing was like feasting on the poor in secret.
parts: You thrust through with his own arrows
They came out like a whirlwind to scatter me;
Their rejoicing was like feasting on the poor in secret.

verses.text: You walked through the sea with Your horses,Through the heap of great waters.
parts: You walked through the sea with Your horses,
Through the heap of great waters.

verses.text: When I heard, my body trembled;My lips quivered at the voice;Rottenness entered my bones;And I trembled in myself,That I might rest in the day of trouble.When he comes up to the people,He will invade them with his troops.
parts: When I heard, my body trembled;
That I might rest in the day of trouble.
When he comes up to the people,
He will invade them with his troops.

verses.text: Though the fig tree may not blossom,Nor fruit be on the vines;Though the labor of the olive may fail,And the fields yield no food;Though the flock may be cut off from the fold,And there be no herd in the stalls—

Nor fruit be on the vines;
Though the labor of the olive may fail,

I will joy in the God of my salvation.

content_parts.text: Some traditions tell us he was the son of Sapnat, of the tribe of Simeon, prophesying in Judah six hundred years before Christ, in the time of King Manasseh.
This would make him a contemporary of the Prophets Nahum, Jeremiah, Daniel, and Zephaniah.
—About 605 BC, during the weakening and collapse of the Southern Kingdom of Judah (626–586 BC) and before the arrival of the Babylonians in Palestine.
Habakkuk agonizes in his soul that wickedness, strife, and oppression are rampant in Judah, but God seemingly does nothing about it.
His perplexity intensifies when he learns God will judge Judah by the hands of the Babylonians, who are more wicked and ruthless than those being judged!
In the end, he learns to rest and trust in God's dealings with His creation.

—Our Orthodox tradition states that this same prophet was indeed the one who was miraculously transported to Babylon and who visited and ministered to Daniel the Prophet in the lions’ den (Bel and the Serpent
Habakkuk entered into rest in great old age, and his relics were discovered during the reign of Theodosius the Great in the fourth century.
